dc_title_s: Map of the route passed over by an expedition into the Indian country in 1832 to the source of the Mississippi
dc_description_s: Relief shown by hachures.; Shows the region between the Red River and Lake Superior, featuring the Mississippi River above Lake Pipin, the Sioux Villages and the Falls of St. Anthony. Originally appeared in Henry Schoolcraft and James Allen's "Journal of an Expedition into the Indian Country to the Source of the Mississippi in 1832".|38 x 48 centimeters|Scale approximately1:364,320; 5 3/4 miles to 1 inch|General Map Collection
